description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 UNDP Funding Facility for Stabilization(FFS) avser att stödja den irakiska regeringens stabiliserings- och återuppbyggnadsbehov i de återtagna områdena, tidigare under IS kontroll, för att bidra till ett säkert och hållbart återvändande av internflyktingar till dessa områden (fokus fyra governorat; Anbar, Salah al-Din, Diyala, Nineweh, som inkluderar östra och västra Mosul).
Faciliteten etablerades av UNDP i dialog med den irakiska regeringen 2015, med stöd från givarsamhället, på grund av den pågående militära konflikten med IS, med omfattande strömmar av internflyktingar och humanitär kris som följd i stora delar av Irak.
Faciliteten är den enda i sitt slag i Irak som verkar så brett inom området för stabilisering och tidig återuppbyggnad och kompletterar det internationella humanitära stödet som annars är det mest omfattande i Irak. Sverige var ett av de drivande länderna för fondfacilitetens tillkomst, och stöd till UNDP har getts av Sverige via UD sedan 2015. Idag samlar fondfaciliteten 24 givarländer, där Sverige fortfarande är en av de största givarna.
Faciliteten består av två kanaler för stöd, Funding Facilitiy for Immediate Stabilization (FFIS) och fr o m 2016 också Funding Facility for Expanding Stabilization (FFES). Den första kanalen fokuserar på stöd till reparation av lätt infrastruktur som kan bidra till att få igång basala samhällstjänster inom sektorer som bl a vatten, el, avlopp, hälsa och utbildning samt kapacitetsstärkande stöd till lokala myndigheter. Det kompletteras med olika komponenter av försörjningsstöd (t ex cash-for work schemes) till utsatta grupper, som återvändande internflyktingar och kvinnoledda hushåll, samt finansiella bidrag till privata näringsidkare som kan bidra till att få igång det lokala näringslivet samt stöd till social sammanhållning (fredsbyggande mellan olika grupper). Programmet bidrar till att bygga resiliens i dessa utsatta lokalsamhällen.
Därutöver kompletteras faciliteten med en andra kanal, FFES, för att möta behovet av stöd till återuppbyggnad av mer omfattande infrastruktur, som t ex rehabilitering av sjukhusbyggnader, universitet, samt rehabilitering av objekt som broar och vägar som i sin tur bidrar till att upprätta stabiliseringskorridorer mellan återtagna områden och städer.
Den preliminära budgeten för hela faciliteten fram till 2023 är 1 880 000 000 USD.

Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS) consists of two channels of support, the original Funding Facility for Immediate Stabilisation (FFIS) and the more recently established channel Funding Facility for Expanded Stabilisation (FFES).
The FFS aim at immediate stabilisation and recovery measures in the liberated areas of IS control, in order for sustainable return of internally displaced persons (IDP) back to these areas (focus four governorat; Anbar, Salah al-Din, Diyala, Nineweh including east and west Mosul).

The Government of Iraq is supported to address the immediate stabilisation and recovery needs in geographical areas retaken from IS in Anbar, Ninewa, Salah-Din, Kirkuk and Diyala which allows for the sustainable return of internally displaced persons (IDPs). FFS is organised in windows that support four types of activities: 1) Public works and light infrastructure rehabilitation with focus on education, electricity, health, housing, roads and bridges, sewage and water; 2) Livelihood assistance including employment; 3) Capacity support including to municipalities; and 4) Peaceful communities through Social cohesion. The intended outcome of the intervention is that people in Iraq, civil society and communities, particularly women, have improved capacity to lead, participate in and contribute to the design and delivery of equitable and responsive services, especially for the most vulnerable populations. The ouputs of the project are: Output 1: Iraqi Government in newly liberated areas is supported to address immediate challenges for return of internally displaced persons. 1.1 Carry out local assessments to identify immediate stabilization needs 1.2 Rehabilitate priority light infrastructure in newly liberated areas 1.3 Support immediate income generation opportunities (Window 2) 1.4. Capacity development of Government authorities to facilitate stabilization (Window 3) 1.5 Design and implement initiatives to promote social cohesion Output 2 High impact medium-sized infrastructure projects are rehabilitated to sustain stabilization gains (FFES) 2.1 Rehabilitation of priority, medium-size infrastructure projects Output 3: Exit Strategy is drafted in consultation with the Government of Iraq, for the liberated governorates. 3.1 Exit Strategy for post-FFS stabilization and development work in the liberated governorates.

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

tag.narrative: 1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, 2 320 projects was completed and 8 510 829 Iraqis ( 4 250 462 women) had benefited from stabilization activities. Thanks in part to the enabling environment created by FFS supported activities about 4, 5 million Iraqis are estimated by IOM to have returned to their area of origin (end of 2019). The commitment of the the GoI to stabilisation was demonstrated in 2019 by the signing of a financing agreement between UNDP and GoI whereby the GoI will contribute USD 33 million to UNDP for stabilization activities. Examples on results:- FFS continued rehabilitating educational facilities, including kindergartens, primary and secondary schools, technical institutes and university buildings.- Work in health sector saw progress both in large scale hospital rehabilitation projects as well as the rehabilitation of community Primary Healthcare Centres.- In West Mosul, significant progress was made in the housing sector, with a total of 4 704 housing units rehabilitating.- In the livelihoods sector, FFS created job opportunities for more than 11000 workers through cash for work. Grant to women-headed households were also distributed with 1000 grants given to women in West Mosul and 3000 grants distributed in Ramani.- Three new bridges had been rehabilitated in East Mosul.- To promote stability, resolve local conflicts and facilitate the return of IDPs, FFS has, in collaboration with GoI and local authorities, supported two community reconciliation initiatives in Salah al Din and Anbar.- In Ninewa, 116 water projects have been completed, including the rehabilitation of the largest single Water Treatment Plant in East Mosul that serves a population of approximately 700 000 in 30 neighbourhoods. The results will be updated in a new Conclusion of Performance when the Annual report for 2020 has been received.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
